description: None of the current img handlers seem to work for the LVM image backend if the libvirt_images_type is lvm. From what I can see in the code it looks like if you are unpartitioned it will work.
title: File injection does not work for partitioned images with LVM image backend

comments.content: None of the current img handlers seem to work for the LVM image backend if the libvirt_images_type is lvm. From what I can see in the code it looks like if you are unpartitioned it will work.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~geekinutah

comments.content: Can you provide more information for us to reproduce this?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zulcss

comments.content:
Sure Chuck, a practical example would be to create a qcow2 image with a boot partition and a '/' partition. Turn any of the file injection options on, like maybe use flat_injected=true. Make sure you have a vg created and that it's in your nova.conf. Also make sure you have libvirt_images_type=lvm.  Also make sure that libvirt_inject_partition is set to 2 for this example.

Try spawning an instance and watch the compute log, you will see that injecting the network template fails. Now try an instance that is unpartitioned, set your libvirt_inject_partition to 0 and it should work.

I have not tested this on master, just on stable/folsom. I have a patch for folsom, but it looks like the current master is significantly different so I am working up a patch for that.
